intro: Carex siccata subsp. pallida, commonly known as the pale sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in spikes. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in desert environments. It has a rhizomatous root system that helps it survive in harsh conditions. Due to its drought tolerance, it is sometimes used in xeriscaping and habitat restoration projects.
